event.doc_name: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

evidence.text: House Defendants shall amend an already existing bill, H.1024, as soon as practicable so as to include the Settlement Maps in H.1024. It is anticipated that H.1024 will pass the Senate and be delivered to the Governor for signature on or before May 12, 2022. Thereafter, the Governor will have until May 17, 2022 to sign and enact H.1024 into law.
evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

add_extracted.value: House Defendants to amend H.1024 to include Settlement Maps with enactment timeline (May 12-17, 2022)

evidence.text: In exchange, SC NAACP will voluntarily dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice by filing a stipulation under Fed. R. Civ. P. 15(a)(2) to amend their Complaint to remove Counts One and Two.
evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

add_extracted.value: SC NAACP to dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice

evidence.text: The Agreement contemplates that if H.1024 is not enacted as agreed upon, House Defendants will provide written consent that there is good cause for SC NAACP to amend their Complaint to re-allege Counts One and Two, or may refile Counts One and Two in a new action.
evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

add_extracted.value: House Defendants to provide written consent for re-filing Counts One and Two if H.1024 not enacted

evidence.text: Under the Agreement, the Parties’ deposition notices, document requests, and discovery motions are withdrawn without prejudice and will only commence if Counts One and Two are refiled as contemplated above.
evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

add_extracted.value: Withdrawal of deposition notices, document requests, and discovery motions

args.reason: All checklist items (Significant_Terms_of_Settlement) are fully extracted with 4 values from Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation. No additional documents contain relevant settlement terms per checklist definition (non-court-ordered terms). All keys are complete.
